meanings.definition: The act of expressing frustration or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Her constant doggoning about the noisy neighbors was getting on everyone's nerves.
meanings.sent2: I could hear his doggoning from across the room, he was clearly upset.
meanings.sent3: After some doggoning, she finally decided to confront the issue directly.
meanings.sent4: The doggoning in the office reached a boiling point, leading to a heated argument.
meanings.sent5: The doggoning in her voice made it clear she had reached her limit.

meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier to emphasize a statement.
meanings.sent1: She was doggoning determined to finish the race, no matter what.
meanings.sent2: He was doggoning excited to finally meet his favorite singer in person.
meanings.sent3: The kids were doggoning happy when they found out about the surprise trip to the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The storm was doggoning fierce, with thunder shaking the windows.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was doggoning proud of her students' hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: A mild expletive used to show surprise or emphasis.
meanings.sent1: Well, doggoning! I can't believe I forgot my lunch at home again.
meanings.sent2: She let out a loud 'doggoning' when she realized she had missed the last bus.
meanings.sent3: The doggoning squirrel stole all the birdseed from the feeder again!
meanings.sent4: He muttered a quick 'doggoning' under his breath when he stubbed his toe.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's 'doggoning' made her parents chuckle at her innocence.
